page.title: 11Crops - Oil Seed Rape
page.content: People often see a field of Oil Seed Rape and think it is mustard. This is easily done as they both have the same bright yellow flower. A few years ago the EEC decided that something had to be done about the shortage of vegetable oils, so they encouraged farmers to grow Rape and in a short time we have managed to grow overwhelming amounts. The growth of Rape has its problems: birds dig up and eat the freshly planted seeds, and sometimes not even gas bangers can drive them away. Also diseases can cause damage if not treated with chemical sprays. Rape is quite expensive, but gives high yields per acre. Large stockpiles have been made, and again this year we may have bumper yields in the Dunmow area and all over Europe.
